definition: to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
inscribed bamboo stick (used in divination, gambling, drawing lots etc)/small wood sliver/label/tag
to agree to and sign (a treaty etc)
to sign a contract or agreement
to sign (one's name with a pen etc)/to autograph/signature
to perform divination with sticks/to draw lots/a ballot (in share dealing)
to issue (a document)/to sign and issue officially
to win a ballot/to draw a lucky number

sentences.english: She would like it signed on a Russian sable coat.
sentences.chinese: 她想让他把名字签在一件俄罗斯的紫貂皮大衣上。

sentences.english: No, I could never agree to sign this contract.
sentences.chinese: 不，我无论如何也不会签这份合同。
她给人连哄带骗签了字。

sentences.english: We'll need you to sign a credit card voucher in advance.
sentences.chinese: 你们需要提前签一下信用卡的单据。

sentences.english: The waiter hands him the bill and the guest signs his name on it.
sentences.chinese: 服务员递过账单，客人在上面签了名。

sentences.english: But no U.S.-Taiwan free trade agreement is pending.
sentences.chinese: 但是，美台签自由贸易协定还遥遥无期。

sentences.english: Prosecutors said Douglas had signed a plea agreement, but the details weren't disclosed.
sentences.chinese: 检察官说他已签了辩诉协议，但没透露具体细节。

sentences.english: Should I sign this paper in pencil or ink ?
sentences.chinese: 我应用铅笔还是墨水笔签这文件呢？

sentences.english: Chelsea have signed Ballack and John Obi Mikel and there is competition.
sentences.chinese: 切尔西已经和布来克和迈克尔签了约，这就是竞争。

sentences.english: Subordinates are not optimistic about Wang Jingwei to sign the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 下属不看好汪精卫要签的协议。

sentences.english: He beguiled me into signing that contract.
sentences.chinese: 他诱骗我签了那份合同。

sentences.english: Where can I get visa on arrival?
sentences.chinese: 正在那里可以办落地签？

sentences.english: Chicken strips marinated with basil threaded on a skewer.
sentences.chinese: 鸡腿肉在意大利香料中浸泡后用串肉签串连。

sentences.english: If you don’t have a contract, start putting one together now.
sentences.chinese: 如果你没有签合同，得赶紧签一个了。

sentences.english: The school singed a building contract with the lowest bidder.
sentences.chinese: 学校和最低的出价者签了建筑的合同。

sentences.english: Mr. Zhang signs the contract on behalf of the China National Silk Import &Export Corporation.
sentences.chinese: 张先生代表中国丝绸进出口总公司在合同上签了字。

definition: to sign a contract or agreement
second round (of a match or election)
to break a promise/breach of contract
to renew or extend a contract
to terminate an agreement/to cancel a contract
